org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster

Class ClusterDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster.ClusterDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CTPClusterDriver, DualThresholdCosmicClusterDriver, GTPClusterDriver, GTPOnlineClusterDriver, ReconClusterDriver, SimpleReconClusterDriver, VTPOnlineCluster2019Driver

    public class ClusterDriver
extends Driver

    This is a Driver that creates ECAL Cluster collections using the Clusterer interface.

    A specific clustering engine can be created with the setClustererName(String) method which will use a factory to create it by name. The cuts of the Clusterer can be set generically with the setCuts(double[]) method.

    See Also:
    Clusterer, NumericalCuts, Cluster, Driver

      • setEcalName

        public void setEcalName(String ecalName)
        Set the name of the ECAL in the detector framework. This is kind of dangerous, so set this argument at your own peril!
        Parameters:
        ecalName - The name of the ECAL.

      • setSkipNoClusterEvents

        public void setSkipNoClusterEvents(boolean skipNoClusterEvents)
        True to raise a NextEventException if no Clusters are created by the Clusterer.
        Parameters:
        skipNoClusterEvents - True to skip events with no clusters.

      • setWriteClusterCollection

        public void setWriteClusterCollection(boolean writeClusterCollection)
        True to write the Cluster collection to the output LCIO file.
        Parameters:
        writeClusterCollection - True to write the Cluster to the event; false to mark as transient.

      • setRaiseErrorNoHitCollection

        public void setRaiseErrorNoHitCollection(boolean raiseErrorNoHitCollection)
        True to raise an exception if the input hit collection is not found in the event.
        Parameters:
        raiseErrorNoHitCollection - True to raise an exception if hit collection is not in event.

      • setStoreHits

        public void setStoreHits(boolean storeHits)
        True to store hit references into the output clusters. This will set LCIOConstants.CLBIT_HITS on the collection flags.
        Parameters:
        storeHits - True to store hits.

      • setSortHits

        public void setSortHits(boolean sortHits)
        True to sort the clusters' hits before writing to event.
        Parameters:
        sortHits - True to sort hits.

      • setClustererName

        public void setClustererName(String name)
        Set the Clusterer by name. This will use a factory method which first tries to use some hard-coded names from the cluster package. As a last resort, it will interpret the name as a canonical class name and try to instantiate it using the Class API.
        Parameters:
        name - The name or canonical class name of the Clusterer.

      • setClusterer

        public void setClusterer(Clusterer clusterer)
        Set the Clusterer which implements the clustering algorithm.
        Parameters:
        clusterer - The Clusterer.

      • setCreateEmptyClusterCollection

        public void setCreateEmptyClusterCollection(boolean createEmptyClusterCollection)
        Set whether an empty collection should be created if there are no clusters made by the Clusterer.
        Parameters:
        createEmptyClusterCollection - True to write an empty collection to the event.

      • setCuts

        public void setCuts(double[] cuts)
        Set the numerical cuts of the Clusterer.
        Parameters:
        cuts - The numerical cuts.

      • setValidateClusters

        public void setValidateClusters(boolean validateClusters)
        Set whether to validate the output.
        Parameters:
        validateClusters - True to validate output.

      • validateClusters

        void validateClusters(EventHeader event)
        Perform basic validation of the cluster output collection, including checking that the cluster collection was created, clusters are not null, none of the clustered hits are null, and each hit exists in the input hit collection.
        Parameters:
        event - The LCSim event.
